answers.answer: Dude u might have caught an STD pls get tested for gonnorhea chlamdyia syphlis and UTI

question: I have been traveling in SE asia for about 3 years ...Three years ago I had sex with a girl with a condom.  After sex I noticed some white goo from her on my pubes as I took the condom off (yeast I assume now).  I did not wash right away.  Within a week I developed a rash but did not treat immediately and it became a bad fungal infection of my penis/groin area all over.  It cleared up after treating for a few weeks with canestan.  I had no risk factors for HIV at that time (all protected sex).  Since then I have had a few unprotected encounters with girls (past 2 years) (no sex workers, girls dated from online).  3 months ago after having vaginal exposure during sex with a new girl I noticed my penis was itchy the following week.  I did see a faint reddish area in the groin and belly button where itched ..  because of my prior experience I applied canestan cream and it cleared within a week.  Lastly I took some antibiotics about a month ago and after completing noticed irritation at the tip of the penis and penis head sensitivity .. walking my penis would rub the inside of my pants and I could feel it get irritated.  so I am applying canestan cream again.  I do not have any other symptoms and otherwise feel healthy.  My question is .. are these symptoms consistent with early HIV?  Reading online makes it sound like Diabetes and HIV are the only likely causes of penile thrush.  Very concerned
title: Is penile thrush likely HIV?
